metadata.title: RBI Grade B - General Awareness Master Question Bank

questions.question: What was India's real GDP growth rate in FY24 according to the Provisional Estimates?
questions.explanation: According to the Provisional Estimates, India’s real GDP grew by 8.2 per cent in FY24, marking the third consecutive year of over 7 per cent growth. (Page 56)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the fiscal deficit of the Union Government as a percentage of GDP in FY24, according to provisional actuals?
questions.explanation: The fiscal deficit of the Union Government was brought down from 6.4 per cent of GDP in FY23 to 5.6 per cent of GDP in FY24, as per provisional actuals data. (Page 64)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The PM-KISAN scheme provides income support to land-holding farmers. What is the total annual financial benefit provided to each eligible farmer family?
questions.explanation: Under the PM-KISAN scheme, an economic benefit of ₹6,000 per year is transferred in three equal four-monthly instalments into the bank accounts of farmers’ families. (Page 378)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was India's Current Account Deficit (CAD) as a percentage of GDP during FY24?
questions.explanation: The Current Account Deficit (CAD) stood at 0.7 per cent of the GDP during FY24, which was a significant improvement from the 2.0 per cent deficit in FY23. (Page 75)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the approximate retail inflation based on the Consumer Price Index (CPI) in FY24?
questions.explanation: After averaging 6.7 per cent in FY23, retail inflation declined to 5.4 per cent in FY24, the lowest level since the Covid-19 pandemic period. (Pages 73, 132)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The PM SVANidhi Scheme, launched in June 2020, was designed to provide financial support to a specific group. Who are the primary beneficiaries of this scheme?
questions.explanation: The PM Street Vendor’s AatmaNirbhar Nidhi (PM SVANidhi) Scheme was launched to facilitate collateral-free working capital loans to street vendors, with over 64 lakh beneficiaries. (Page 331)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the Gross Non-Performing Assets (GNPA) ratio of Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) at the end of March 2024?
questions.explanation: Data from the RBI’s Financial Stability Report shows that the Gross Non-Performing Assets (GNPA) ratio of SCBs declined to a 12-year low of 2.8 per cent in March 2024. (Pages 74, 93)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: India's female labour force participation rate (FLFPR) has been on a consistent rise. What was the FLFPR recorded in 2022-23?
questions.explanation: According to the annual PLFS, the female labour force participation rate rose for the sixth consecutive year, reaching 37 per cent in 2022-23 from 23.3 per cent in 2017-18. (Page 79)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the percentage growth in the Gross Value Added (GVA) of the manufacturing sector in FY24?
questions.explanation: The manufacturing sector's GVA grew by 9.9 per cent in FY24, benefiting from reduced input prices and stable domestic demand. (Page 57)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The 'Insurance for all' mission is a key regulatory vision for the insurance sector. By which year does this mission aim to achieve its goal?
questions.explanation: Supported by regulatory measures and the vision to achieve ‘Insurance for all by 2047’, India is poised to emerge as one of the fastest-growing insurance markets. (Page 84)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the total capital expenditure of the Union Government for FY24 as per Provisional Actuals?
questions.explanation: The Provisional Actuals show that capital expenditure for FY24 stood at ₹9.5 lakh crore, marking an increase of 28.2 per cent on a YoY basis and 2.8 times the level of FY20. (Page 68)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: India witnessed a robust inflow of Foreign Portfolio Investment (FPI) in FY24. What was the total value of net FPI inflows during this period?
questions.explanation: Net FPI inflows stood at USD 44.1 billion during FY24, a significant turnaround from the net outflows in the preceding two years, which helped fund the CAD. (Page 75)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: According to the Periodic Labour Force Survey (PLFS) for 2022-23, what percentage of the total workforce is employed in agriculture?
questions.explanation: As per the PLFS, more than 45 per cent (specifically 45.8% as shown in Chart VIII.3) of the workforce is employed in agriculture, highlighting its predominance in providing employment. (Page 321)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Jal Jeevan Mission aims to provide tap water connections to all rural households. As of July 2024, approximately how many rural households have been provided with these connections?
questions.explanation: The Jal Jeevan Mission has successfully provided tap water connections to 11.7 crore households as of July 10, 2024, significantly enhancing the quality of life in rural areas. (Page 255)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The number of Initial Public Offers (IPOs) saw a significant increase in FY24 compared to FY23. What was the total number of IPOs in FY24?
questions.explanation: The number of initial public offers (IPOs) increased by 66 per cent in FY24, rising from 164 in FY23 to 272 in FY24, reflecting a robust primary market. (Page 110)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The PM Vishwakarma scheme, launched in September 2023, provides a stipend to artisans during the basic skill training period. What is the stipend amount provided per day?
questions.explanation: Under the PM Vishwakarma scheme's skill upgradation module, basic skill training is provided with a stipend of ₹500 per day to offset wage loss. (Page 361)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the total number of subscribers under the National Pension Scheme (NPS) and Atal Pension Yojana (APY) as of March 2024?
questions.explanation: India's pension sector has expanded significantly, with the total number of subscribers under NPS and APY reaching 735.6 lakh as of March 2024, registering a YoY growth of 18 per cent. (Page 125)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Indian tech start-up ecosystem saw significant activity in 2023. According to NASSCOM, approximately how many new tech start-ups were established during the year?
questions.explanation: As per NASSCOM, the Indian technology start-up sector witnessed the inception of roughly 1,000 new tech start-ups in 2023, taking the total number to approximately 31,000. (Page 395)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Which of the following macroeconomic variables did NOT experience a higher Compounded Quarterly Growth Rate (CQGR) in the post-pandemic period (Q3 FY21 – Q4 FY24) compared to the pre-pandemic period (Q1 FY12 – Q4 FY20)?
questions.explanation: Table I.1 shows that the CQGR for all key macroeconomic variables, including GDP, GVA, PFCE, Industrial GVA, Services GVA, and GFCF, was greater in the period Q3 FY21 – Q4 FY24 than in the pre-pandemic period, indicating a strong economic recovery. (Page 63)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the revamped Credit Guarantee Scheme (CGS) for MSEs, several changes were introduced to facilitate additional credit. Which combination of corpus infusion and enhanced credit limit is correct?

options.A: Corpus infusion of ₹5,000 crore; credit limit enhanced to ₹3 crore
options.B: Corpus infusion of ₹7,000 crore; credit limit enhanced to ₹4 crore
options.C: Corpus infusion of ₹9,000 crore; credit limit enhanced to ₹5 crore
options.D: Corpus infusion of ₹10,000 crore; credit limit enhanced to ₹7 crore
options.E: Corpus infusion of ₹12,000 crore; credit limit enhanced to ₹10 crore

questions.explanation: In the Union Budget FY23, the CGS for MSEs was revamped with an infusion of ₹9,000 crore in the corpus of the Credit Guarantee Fund Trust for MSEs, and the credit limit was enhanced from ₹2 crore to ₹5 crore. (Page 92)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Based on the Provisional Actuals for Union Government capex in FY24, which of the following sectors witnessed the highest YoY percentage growth over FY23?
questions.explanation: According to Table I.2, the capex for Railways grew by 52.3% in FY24 (PA) over FY23, the highest among the major sectors listed. Road Transport grew by 28.1%, Transfer to States by 32.5%, and Defence Services by 7.9%. (Page 68)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Regarding the resolution of corporate debtors under the IBC until March 2024, what was the approximate recovery percentage for creditors relative to the liquidation value of the assets?
questions.explanation: In the cases resolved through approved resolution plans under IBC, creditors recovered approximately 32% of their claims, which amounted to a recovery of 162% of the liquidation value of the assets. (Page 99)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The composition of India's merchandise exports shifted between FY23 and FY24. Which statement accurately describes this change?

options.A: The share of consumer goods increased significantly, while capital goods decreased.
options.B: The share of capital goods rose from 16.3% to 18.9%, while consumer goods declined from 48.9% to 47.5%.
options.C: The share of intermediate goods rose, while capital goods remained stagnant.
options.D: The shares of both capital goods and consumer goods saw a substantial increase.
options.E: The shares of both capital goods and consumer goods declined significantly.

questions.explanation: From FY23 to FY24, the share of capital goods in merchandise exports rose substantially from 16.3% to 18.9%. Conversely, the share of consumer goods declined from 48.9% to 47.5%, and intermediate goods also declined from 30.2% to 28.4%. (Page 158)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Which of the following statements about the sectoral share of factory employment in FY22 is INCORRECT?

options.A: The food products industry was the largest employer with an 11% share.
options.B: Textiles and Wearing Apparel together accounted for a 17% share.
options.C: The Computer, etc. sector had the smallest share among those listed, at 2%.
options.D: Chemicals and Rubber & Plastic sectors each held a 6% share.
options.E: The motor vehicles sector had a larger share than the basic metals sector.

questions.explanation: According to Chart VIII.16, the food products industry was the largest employer (11%). Textiles (10%) and Wearing Apparel (7%) together made up 17%. The Motor Vehicles sector had a 7% share, which is the same as, not larger than, the Basic Metals sector's 7% share. (Page 328)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Based on NITI Aayog's analysis, approximately how many crore people are estimated to have escaped multidimensional poverty between 2015-16 and 2019-21?
questions.explanation: The analysis shows a sharp decline in multidimensional poverty, with an estimated 13.5 crore Indians escaping it between 2015-16 and 2019-21, putting India on track to achieve SDG Target 1.2 well ahead of 2030. (Page 265)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the estimated real GDP growth for India in FY25, as per the first advance estimates?
questions.explanation: According to the first advance estimates released by the National Statistical Office (MoSPI), the real gross domestic product (GDP) growth for FY25 is estimated to be 6.4 per cent. (Page 56)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Gross Non-Performing Assets (NPAs) ratio for Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) declined to what 12-year low at the end of September 2024?
questions.explanation: As per the RBI’s Financial Stability Report (December 2024), the gross non-performing assets (NPAs) in the banking system have declined to a 12-year low of 2.6 per cent of gross loans and advances as of September 2024. (Page 74, 84)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the unemployment rate for individuals aged 15 years and above in 2023-24, according to the annual Periodic Labour Force Survey (PLFS) report?
questions.explanation: The unemployment rate for individuals aged 15 years and above has steadily declined from 6 per cent in 2017-18 to 3.2 per cent in 2023-24, as per the 2023-24 annual PLFS report. (Page 76)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What policy repo rate was maintained by the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) of the RBI during its meetings in the first nine months of FY25 (April-December 2024)?
questions.explanation: During the first nine months of FY25 (April 2024-December 2024), the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) of the RBI decided to keep the policy repo rate unchanged at 6.5 per cent. (Page 81)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: India's Current Account Deficit (CAD) moderated to what percentage of GDP in Q2 of FY25?
questions.explanation: India's current account deficit (CAD) moderated slightly to 1.2 per cent of GDP in Q2 of FY25, compared to 1.3 per cent in Q2 of FY24. (Page 104)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the estimated growth of Gross Fixed Capital Formation (GFCF) at constant prices for FY25?
questions.explanation: Gross fixed capital formation (GFCF) at constant prices is estimated to grow by 6.4 per cent in FY25. (Page 56)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The total Kharif food grain production for 2024-25 is estimated at a record level. What is this estimated production?
questions.explanation: As per the first advanced estimates of agricultural production for 2024-25, total Kharif food grain production is estimated at a record 1647.05 lakh metric tonnes (LMT). (Page 59, 291)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What growth rate is projected for India's economy in FY26?
questions.explanation: On balance of considerations regarding robust domestic fundamentals and global headwinds, the Economic Survey expects that the growth in FY26 would be between 6.3 and 6.8 per cent. (Page 78)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The services sector growth in FY25 is expected to remain robust. What is the estimated growth rate for the sector?
questions.explanation: Growth in the services sector is expected to remain robust at 7.2 per cent in FY25, driven by healthy activity in various sub-sectors. (Page 57)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the value of the RBI's Financial Inclusion Index at the end of March 2024, indicating significant progress in financial inclusion?
questions.explanation: The government has achieved significant progress in financial inclusion, with the Financial Inclusion Index of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) increasing from 53.9 in March 2021 to 64.2 at the end of March 2024. (Page 80, 88)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Capital-to-Risk-Weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR) for Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) stood well above the norm as of September 2024. What was this ratio?
questions.explanation: The capital-to-risk-weighted assets ratio (CRAR) for SCBs stands at 16.7 per cent as of September 2024, well above the regulatory norm, indicating robust capital buffers. (Page 74, 84)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The National Infrastructure Pipeline (NIP) was launched with a forward-looking approach targeting a projected infrastructure investment of around what amount from FY20 to FY25?
questions.explanation: The National Infrastructure Pipeline (NIP) was launched with a forward-looking approach, targeting a projected infrastructure investment of around ₹111 lakh crore from FY20 to FY25. (Page 209)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the Amrit Bharat Station Scheme, how many railway stations have been identified for redevelopment to enhance amenities?
questions.explanation: Under the Amrit Bharat Station Scheme, aimed at enhancing railway station amenities, 1337 stations have been identified for redevelopment. (Page 212)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The agriculture sector is expected to rebound in FY25. What is the estimated growth rate for the sector?
questions.explanation: On the supply side, the agriculture sector is expected to rebound to a growth of 3.8 per cent in FY25. (Page 56)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Private Final Consumption Expenditure (PFCE) growth at constant prices is estimated to be a key driver of demand in FY25. What is the estimated growth rate for PFCE?
questions.explanation: From the angle of aggregate demand, private final consumption expenditure (PFCE) at constant prices is estimated to grow by 7.3 per cent, driven by a rebound in rural demand. (Page 56)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the estimated growth rate for the industrial sector in FY25?
questions.explanation: The industrial sector is estimated to grow by 6.2 per cent in FY25, supported by strong growth in construction and electricity. (Page 56)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Assets Under Management (AuM) of the mutual fund industry saw remarkable growth, reaching what value as of December 2024?
questions.explanation: The surge in participation and strong market performance led to a remarkable increase in mutual funds’ assets under management (AuM), which rose to ₹66.9 lakh crore as of December 2024. (Page 101)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Bharatmala Pariyojana, launched in October 2017, aims to develop a specific length of National Highways. What is this targeted length?
questions.explanation: The Bharatmala Pariyojana, launched in October 2017, aims to develop 34,800 km of National Highways to improve connectivity and logistics efficiency. (Page 214)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Private Final Consumption Expenditure (PFCE) as a share of GDP reached its highest level since FY03 in FY25. What was this share?
questions.explanation: PFCE as a share of GDP (at current prices) is estimated to increase from 60.3 per cent in FY24 to 61.8 per cent in FY25, which is the highest share recorded since FY03. (Page 56)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In its December 2024 meeting, the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) announced a cut in the Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR). What was the quantum of the cut and the expected liquidity infusion?

options.A: Cut to 4.25% from 4.5%, infusing ₹0.96 lakh crore
options.B: Cut to 4.0% from 4.5%, infusing ₹1.16 lakh crore
options.C: Cut to 3.75% from 4.25%, infusing ₹1.25 lakh crore
options.D: Cut to 4.0% from 4.25%, infusing ₹1.00 lakh crore
options.E: Cut to 3.5% from 4.0%, infusing ₹1.36 lakh crore

questions.explanation: In its December 2024 meeting, the MPC announced a cut in the Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR) to 4 per cent of the net demand and time liabilities (NDTL) from 4.5 per cent. The decision is expected to infuse around ₹1.16 lakh crore liquidity into the banking system. (Pages 81-82)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The 'credit-to-GDP gap' is a key indicator of financial cycle stress. How did this gap change for India from Q1 of FY23 to Q1 of FY25?
questions.explanation: With credit growth outpacing nominal GDP growth for two successive years, the credit-GDP gap narrowed significantly to (-) 0.3 per cent in Q1 of FY25 from (-) 10.3 per cent in Q1 of FY23, indicating sustainable credit growth. (Page 87)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: India's share in global IPO listings saw a significant surge in 2024, making it the leading contributor globally. What was the increase in its share compared to 2023?
questions.explanation: India's share in global IPO listings surged to 30 per cent in 2024, up from 17 per cent in 2023, making it the leading contributor of primary resource mobilisation globally. (Page 97)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: For the fiscal year FY25, the government increased the Minimum Support Price (MSP) for certain crops significantly over the weighted average cost of production. What was the respective MSP increase for arhar and bajra?
questions.explanation: For the fiscal year FY25, the MSP for arhar and bajra has been increased by 59 per cent and 77 per cent over the weighted average cost of production, respectively. (Page 295)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The PM - Surya Ghar: Muft Bijli Yojana aims to promote residential rooftop solar capacity. What are the key targets of this scheme?
questions.explanation: The PM - Surya Ghar: Muft Bijli Yojana aims to install rooftop solar plants in one crore households, which is expected to enable approximately 30 gigawatts of residential rooftop solar capacity and contribute to an overall rooftop solar capacity addition of 40-45 gigawatts by 2027. (Page 289)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: At the end of December 2024, the BSE market capitalisation to GDP ratio rose significantly. What was this ratio, indicating a high level of market valuation?
questions.explanation: The BSE market capitalisation to GDP ratio stood at 136 per cent at the end of December 2024, rising significantly over the last 10 years and indicating increased market capitalisation relative to the size of the economy. (Page 100)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Throughout the financial year 2023-24, what was the policy repo rate maintained by the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC)?
questions.explanation: Considering the growth-inflation dynamics, the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) kept the policy repo rate unchanged at 6.50 per cent during 2023-24. (Page 29, Para I.14)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the projected real GDP growth for the Indian economy in the financial year 2024-25, as stated in the report?
questions.explanation: Taking into account factors like favorable agriculture prospects, traction in construction, and investments under the PLI scheme, the real GDP growth for 2024-25 is projected at 7.0 per cent with risks evenly balanced. (Page 34, Para I.38)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the size of the Reserve Bank's balance sheet as a percentage of GDP at the end of March 2024?
questions.explanation: The Reserve Bank’s balance sheet size increased to 24.1 per cent of GDP at end-March 2024 from 23.5 per cent at end-March 2023. The balance sheet has normalised to its pre-pandemic level. (Page 68, Para II.4.4)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the amount of surplus transferred by the Reserve Bank of India to the Central Government for the financial year 2023-24?
questions.explanation: For the financial year 2023-24, the surplus transferred to the Central Government was ₹2,10,873.99 crore. This was a significant increase from the previous year's transfer of ₹87,416.22 crore. (Page 243, Table XII.1)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: On June 26, 2023, the RBI prescribed a new standardised approach for determining minimum capital requirements for which type of risk, aligning with revised Basel standards?
questions.explanation: The Reserve Bank prescribed the new standardised approach for determining the minimum capital requirements for operational risk in order to secure greater convergence with the revised Basel standards. This new approach replaces all previously prescribed methods. (Page 145, Para VI.28)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the average daily net absorption under the Liquidity Adjustment Facility (LAF) during 2023-24, indicating a significant tightening of liquidity conditions?
questions.explanation: Liquidity conditions tightened during 2023-24 in sync with the monetary policy stance. The liquidity surplus as reflected in average daily net absorption under the LAF moderated to ₹485 crore during 2023-24 from ₹1.87 lakh crore in the previous year. (Page 29, Para I.14)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Prompt Corrective Action (PCA) framework for NBFCs was extended to include certain government NBFCs. From which date will this extension be applicable?
questions.explanation: The Prompt Corrective Action (PCA) framework, introduced for NBFCs in December 2021, has been extended to government NBFCs (except those in Base Layer) and it would be applicable with effect from October 1, 2024. (Page 31, Para I.24)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the guidelines on Default Loss Guarantee (DLG) in Digital Lending, what is the maximum percentage of the outstanding loan portfolio that a Lending Service Provider (LSP) can guarantee?
questions.explanation: The guidelines on DLG arrangements lay down several regulatory guardrails, including a limit on DLG to five per cent of the outstanding loan portfolio. (Page 143, Para VI.21)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: To manage surplus liquidity arising from the return of ₹2000 banknotes, the RBI implemented a temporary Incremental Cash Reserve Ratio (I-CRR). During which period was this measure effective?
questions.explanation: An incremental cash reserve ratio (I-CRR) was applied as a temporary measure during August 12 to October 7, 2023 to absorb the surplus liquidity resulting from the return of ₹2000 banknotes to the banking system. (Page 106, Para III.2)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In September 2023, RBI issued revised Directions for the classification of investment portfolios of commercial banks. What are the three new principle-based categories introduced?

options.A: Held for Trading, Available for Sale, Held to Maturity
options.B: Held to Maturity, Available for Sale, Fair Value through Profit and Loss
options.C: Held for Trading, Held to Maturity, Not for Sale
options.D: Fair Value, Amortised Cost, Held for Trading

questions.explanation: The revised Directions introduced a principle-based classification of the investment portfolio into three categories: ‘Held to Maturity’ (HTM), ‘Available for Sale’ (AFS), and ‘Fair Value through Profit and Loss Account’ (FVTPL). (Page 145, Para VI.27)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Which component is the largest constituent of Reserve Money (RM) with a share of approximately 75.1 per cent in 2023-24?

options.D: Government's currency liabilities to the public

questions.explanation: The growth in currency in circulation (CiC) - the major constituent of RM with a share of 75.1 per cent – decelerated to 4.1 per cent during 2023-24 from 7.8 per cent a year ago. (Page 69, Para II.4.5)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the total amount of gold held by the Reserve Bank of India as of March 31, 2024?
questions.explanation: As on March 31, 2024, the total gold held by the Reserve Bank was 822.10 metric tonnes, an increase from 794.63 metric tonnes on March 31, 2023. (Page 261, Para ii and Table XII.4)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: To improve compliance culture and promote ethical standards, the RBI issued a final omnibus framework for recognizing Self-Regulatory Organisations (SROs) for its Regulated Entities (REs) on which date?
questions.explanation: A draft of the omnibus framework for SROs was released for comments in December 2023, following which, the final framework was issued on March 21, 2024. (Page 142, Para VI.15)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: During 2023-24, the pilot for the Central Bank Digital Currency-Retail (e₹-R) was expanded. How many banks and locations did the pilot cover by the end of the year?
questions.explanation: The pilot in the e₹-R segment was expanded to 15 banks and covered 81 locations. Interoperability between UPI and CBDC was also introduced to leverage UPI acceptance infrastructure. (Page 32, Para I.25; Page 151, Para VI.43)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: According to the data on key drivers of liquidity, which of the following factors was the primary driver leading to a net liquidity deficit (injection) of ₹0.76 lakh crore in Q3 2023-24?

options.A: Large net forex purchases by the RBI
options.B: A significant drawdown in Government of India cash balances
options.C: The withdrawal of ₹2000 banknotes from circulation
options.D: Festival-related currency outgo and build-up of government cash balances
options.E: Return of funds from the Incremental Cash Reserve Ratio (I-CRR)

questions.explanation: Liquidity turned into deficit in Q3, with an average net LAF injection of ₹0.76 lakh crore, driven by festival-related currency outgo (withdrawal of Currency in Circulation) in October-November and the build-up of government cash balances in December 2023. (Page 112, Para III.19 and Table III.2)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: During the monetary tightening cycle from May 2022 to March 2024, while the policy repo rate increased by 250 basis points, what was the extent of transmission to the weighted average lending rates (WALR) on fresh and outstanding rupee loans, respectively?

options.A: 250 bps on fresh loans and 250 bps on outstanding loans
options.B: 186 bps on fresh loans and 113 bps on outstanding loans
options.C: 113 bps on fresh loans and 186 bps on outstanding loans
options.D: 167 bps on fresh loans and 113 bps on outstanding loans
options.E: 250 bps on fresh loans and 185 bps on outstanding loans

questions.explanation: During the tightening cycle from May 2022 to March 2024, the WALR on fresh rupee loans rose by 186 bps while that on outstanding loans rose by 113 bps, showing incomplete but significant transmission of the 250 bps repo rate hike. (Page 115, Table III.4)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In the expansion of RBI's balance sheet during FY 2023-24, which asset category witnessed the highest percentage growth?
questions.explanation: The increase on the assets side of the RBI's balance sheet was due to a rise in foreign investments, gold, and loans and advances by 13.90 per cent, 18.26 per cent, and 30.05 per cent, respectively. Loans and Advances saw the highest growth. (Page 243, Para XII.3)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The RBI harmonised the provisioning norms for standard assets across all tiers of Urban Cooperative Banks (UCBs). For Tier I UCBs, what is the revised uniform provisioning requirement, and by what deadline must they achieve it in a staggered manner?
questions.explanation: The provisioning norms for standard assets applicable to UCBs were harmonised. Tier I UCBs were permitted to achieve the revised requirement of 0.40 per cent as standard asset provisioning vis-à-vis the earlier requirement of 0.25 per cent in a staggered manner by March 31, 2025. (Page 144, Para VI.24)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In response to concerns about 'evergreening' through Alternative Investment Funds (AIFs), what action is mandated for a Regulated Entity (RE) if an AIF scheme it has invested in subsequently invests in a debtor company of that RE?

options.A: Make a 50% provision on the investment and report to RBI within 15 days.
options.B: Immediately exit all investments in any AIFs.
options.C: Liquidate its investment in that specific AIF within 30 days or make a 100% provision.
options.D: Transfer the investment from 'Available for Sale' to 'Held to Maturity' category.
options.E: Obtain a no-objection certificate from RBI to continue the investment.

questions.explanation: To prohibit prudential violations like evergreening, REs were mandated to liquidate their existing investments in AIFs within a stipulated period of 30 days if the AIF scheme had invested or subsequently invests in the RE's debtor company. Failing this, the RE must make a full provision for their investment in that particular scheme. (Page 144, Para VI.26)

questions.question: For individuals who are residents in India and aged eighty years or more, what is the basic exemption limit where no income tax is charged for the assessment year 2025-26?
questions.explanation: According to The First Schedule, Part I, for every individual resident in India aged eighty years or more, no income tax is levied where the total income does not exceed Rs. 5,00,000. (Page 82)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the income tax rate for total income from Rs. 4,00,001 to Rs. 8,00,000 for individuals under the new tax regime (Section 115BAC) for the assessment year 2026-27?
questions.explanation: The amendment to Section 115BAC specifies a tax rate of 5 per cent for total income ranging from Rs. 4,00,001 to Rs. 8,00,000, effective from the assessment year 2026-27. (Page 46)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: For the assessment year 2025-26, what is the surcharge rate on income tax for a firm or local authority whose total income exceeds one crore rupees?
questions.explanation: In the case of every firm or local authority with a total income exceeding one crore rupees, the income tax shall be increased by a surcharge calculated at the rate of twelve per cent. (Page 13, 85, 86)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The threshold for no deduction of tax at source on rent under Section 194-I has been revised. What is the new monthly rent threshold below which no TDS is required?
questions.explanation: The amendment to Section 194-I substitutes the first proviso to state that no deduction shall be made where the income by way of rent credited or paid for a month or part of a month does not exceed fifty thousand rupees. (Page 56)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The benefit for eligible start-ups under Section 80-IAC, which provides for a 100% deduction of profits for three consecutive years, has been extended. The benefit is now available to start-ups incorporated before which date?
questions.explanation: The amendment to Section 80-IAC extends the benefit period for eligible start-ups for another five years, making the benefit available to start-ups incorporated before the 1st April, 2030. (Page 43, 148)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Effective from April 1, 2026, the tax rebate under Section 87A for individuals under the new tax regime (Section 115BAC) has been increased. What are the new income and rebate limits, respectively?

options.A: Income up to Rs. 7 lakh, rebate up to Rs. 25,000
options.B: Income up to Rs. 10 lakh, rebate up to Rs. 50,000
options.C: Income up to Rs. 12 lakh, rebate up to Rs. 60,000
options.D: Income up to Rs. 15 lakh, rebate up to Rs. 75,000
options.E: Income up to Rs. 9 lakh, rebate up to Rs. 45,000

questions.explanation: The amendment to the proviso of Section 87A substitutes 'seven hundred thousand rupees' with 'twelve hundred thousand rupees' and 'twenty-five thousand rupees' with 'sixty thousand rupees', raising the income limit to Rs. 12 lakh and the rebate limit to Rs. 60,000. (Page 43, 149)

questions.question: What is the surcharge rate applicable to a domestic company for the assessment year 2025-26 if its total income exceeds one crore rupees but does not exceed ten crore rupees?
questions.explanation: For a domestic company with a total income exceeding one crore rupees but not exceeding ten crore rupees, the surcharge on income-tax is calculated at the rate of seven per cent. (Page 87, 106)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the surcharge rate applicable to a co-operative society for the assessment year 2025-26 if its total income exceeds ten crore rupees?
questions.explanation: In the case of every co-operative society having a total income exceeding ten crore rupees, the surcharge on income-tax is calculated at the rate of twelve per cent. (Page 13, 85)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The threshold for TDS on payment of compensation on acquisition of immovable property under Section 194LA has been revised. What is the new aggregate payment limit during a financial year below which no tax is deductible?
questions.explanation: The first proviso of Section 194LA has been amended, replacing 'two lakh and fifty thousand rupees' with 'five lakh rupees' as the threshold for TDS on compensation payments. (Page 57, 168)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the amendment to Section 194LBC, what is the new uniform rate of tax to be deducted at source on income payable to a resident investor from a securitisation trust?
questions.explanation: Section 194LBC has been amended to provide a reduced uniform TDS rate of 10% on income in respect of investment in a securitisation trust, replacing the previous differential rates of 25% and 30%. (Page 57, 168)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The time limit for filing an updated income tax return under Section 139(8A) has been extended. What is the new maximum period for filing an updated return from the end of the relevant assessment year?
questions.explanation: The amendment to sub-section (8A) of Section 139 extends the time-limit to file an updated return from twenty-four months to forty-eight months from the end of the relevant assessment year. (Page 50, 157)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The commencement of operations for a unit in an International Financial Services Centre leasing an aircraft or ship has been extended to claim deductions under Section 80LA. What is the new deadline?
questions.explanation: The amendment to Section 80LA extends the date of commencement of operations for a unit leasing an aircraft or a ship from 31st March, 2025 to 31st March, 2030. (Page 43, 149)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: A new clause (12BA) in Section 10 allows tax exemption on partial withdrawal from a minor's National Pension System account. What is the maximum percentage of contributions made by the parent/guardian that can be withdrawn tax-free?
questions.explanation: The newly inserted clause (12BA) in Section 10 provides that any payment from the NPS Trust on partial withdrawal from a minor's account is exempt to the extent it does not exceed twenty-five per cent of the contributions made. (Page 36, 141)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the revised TDS threshold for income by way of insurance commission under Section 194D, below which no tax deduction is required during a financial year?
questions.explanation: The second proviso to Section 194D is amended to increase the threshold of aggregated amounts of income from insurance commission, for the requirement to deduct tax at source, from fifteen thousand rupees to twenty thousand rupees. (Page 56, 165)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the amendment to Section 140B, what is the additional income-tax payable if an updated return is filed after the expiry of twenty-four months but before thirty-six months from the end of the relevant assessment year?
questions.explanation: A new clause (iii) is inserted in Section 140B(3) which prescribes that sixty per cent of the aggregate of tax and interest payable shall be the additional income-tax if the updated return is furnished after twenty-four months but before thirty-six months from the end of the relevant assessment year. (Page 50, 158)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: For a scheme of amalgamation of a banking company brought into force on or after April 1, 2025, for how many assessment years can the accumulated loss of the original predecessor entity be carried forward in the hands of the successor entity?
questions.explanation: The amendment to Section 72AA specifies that for amalgamations effective on or after April 1, 2025, any loss of the predecessor entity shall be carried forward in the hands of the successor entity for not more than eight assessment years immediately succeeding the assessment year for which the loss was first computed for the original predecessor entity. (Page 41, 147)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: A new Section 44BBD introduces a special provision for computing profits for non-residents providing services or technology for setting up electronics manufacturing in India. What percentage of the aggregate amounts received or paid is deemed to be profits and gains of such business?
questions.explanation: The new Section 44BBD(1) states that a sum equal to twenty-five per cent of the aggregate of specified amounts shall be deemed to be the profits and gains of the business of the non-resident assessee, chargeable to tax under 'Profits and gains of business or profession'. (Page 39, 145)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: For which period has a retrospective exemption from service tax been granted for reinsurance services provided by insurance companies under the Weather Based Crop Insurance Scheme and Modified National Agricultural Insurance Scheme?
questions.explanation: Clause 130 provides a special retrospective exemption from service tax for reinsurance services under specified schemes for the period commencing from the 1st day of April, 2011 and ending with the 30th day of June, 2017 (both days inclusive). (Page 77, 182)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the amendment to Section 9A, if an eligible investment fund's aggregate participation from Indian residents exceeds 5% on April 1st or October 1st, what is the timeframe within which this must be rectified for the condition to be deemed satisfied?
questions.explanation: A new proviso in Section 9A(3)(c) states that if the aggregate participation exceeds five per cent on the first day of April or October, the condition is deemed satisfied if it is rectified within four months of that date. (Page 34, 140)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The new Section 285BAA introduces an obligation to furnish information on crypto-asset transactions. If a reporting entity furnishes a defective statement and fails to rectify it within the prescribed time, what is the legal consequence?

options.A: A flat penalty of Rs. 1,00,000 will be imposed.
options.B: The provisions of the Act will apply as if the person had furnished inaccurate information.
options.C: The entity's registration will be cancelled immediately.
options.D: A penalty of 1% of the transaction value will be levied.
options.E: The entity will be barred from reporting for one year.

questions.explanation: According to the newly inserted Section 285BAA(2), if a defect in a furnished statement is not rectified within the given period, the provisions of the Income-tax Act shall apply as if such person had furnished inaccurate information in the statement. (Page 62, 168)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: With effect from April 1, 2026, what will be the revised rate of tax on long-term capital gains for Foreign Institutional Investors arising from the transfer of securities (not covered under Section 112A), as per the amendment to Section 115AD?
questions.explanation: Clause 23 of the Bill amends Section 115AD, substituting the tax rate of 'ten per cent' with 'twelve and one-half per cent' for long-term capital gains on securities for FIIs, effective from 1st April, 2026. (Page 46, 152)
